name: Mighty Tinkerer!
description: Tinkers' Construct completely revolutionizes the way you gather and process materials.  This guide will walk you through getting your first tool and start smelting materials.

quests.name: Putting it all together
quests.description: Now we need to build the smeltery and fill it with lava.  Use 4 blocks in a square as your floor, then two blocks on each side for your walls.  Then just build up from there.

tasks.longDescription: Put together your smeltery and then fill it with lava.

quests.name: Containing the flow 2
quests.description: Once you have a controller, you need to contain the lava that you will use to smelt with.  You can either use a seared tank, or any seared window or gauge.

tasks.longDescription: Use 8 seared bricks and glass to make a seared tank.

quests.name: Making the block
quests.description: With the small seared bricks you can make a seared bricks block.  This block is the base building block for the entire smeltery.

tasks.longDescription: Put 4 seared bricks in a crafting table to get a block of seared bricks.

quests.name: Proper work space 2
quests.description: Every Tinkerer needs a proper work space.  The second space you will be working with is your pattern chest.

tasks.longDescription: Use a blank pattern with a chest to make a pattern chest.

quests.name: Searing for flavour!
quests.description: Once we have grout we can smelt it into brick.  As we step through making the smeltery, you will need a total of about 100 seared bricks (not blocks) to make the entire thing. (You get some more while completing these quests).

tasks.longDescription: Smelt some grout in an oven to get a seared brick.

quests.name: Tools of the trade 2
quests.description: Now that you have your work space set up, we need to make our tools.  The first useful tool is a mattock.  It's great for farming, digging, and chopping trees; pretty much an all around tool for our current stranded situation.

tasks.longDescription: Use cobble stone to make your axe and shovel head, and wood to make your tool rod.

quests.name: Containing the flow 1
quests.description: Now that we have blocks, let's make a smeltery controller so we can monitor and control our smelting.

tasks.longDescription: Use 8 seared bricks to make a smeltery controller.

quests.name: Containing the flow 4
quests.description: The last thing we need is a basin or table that we can use to shape what we pour using casts.  Let's start with a casting table.

tasks.longDescription: Use 7 seared bricks to make a casting table.

quests.name: Containing the flow 3
quests.description: Now that we have what's needed to smelt, we need to be able to pour our smelted material.  All we need is a drain and a facuet on our drain to pour molten material.

tasks.longDescription: Use 9 seared bricks to make a drain and faucet.

quests.name: Proper Work Space 1
quests.description: Every Tinkerer needs a proper work space.  The first space you will be working with is your stencil table.

tasks.longDescription: Use a blank pattern with wood planks to make a Stencil Table.

quests.name: Molten materials
quests.description: Now that we are making alloys along with making casts to use the molten materials, let's make an iron axe head to upgrade our mattock with.  (Tip: the material that's at the bottom of the smeltery is the one you will pour).

tasks.longDescription: Put iron in the smeltery and select it in the controller.  Pour the iron into your axe mold in the casting table to make the iron axe head.

quests.name: Tools of the trade 1
quests.description: Now that you have your work space set up, we need to make our tools.  The first useful tool is a mattock.  It's great for farming, digging, and chopping trees; pretty much an all around tool for our current stranded situation.

tasks.longDescription: Use your stencil table with blank patterns to make an axe head pattern, shovel head pattern, and tool rod pattern.  All this work is making me hungry!

quests.name: I am Grout!
quests.description: The first step in getting started smelting ores is to get soem grout.  Grout is the core material used in making seared bricks.

tasks.longDescription: Make some grout using gravel, clay, and sand.

quests.name: Proper work space 4
quests.description: Every Tinkerer needs a proper work space.  The fourth space that ties everything together is your tool station.

tasks.longDescription: Use a blank pattern with a crafting station or table to make a tool station.

quests.name: Creating the mold
quests.description: You are about ready to start upgrading your tools with higher level metals.  Before we do that, we need to make a stone axe head in the Tinkers' part builder so we can cast our axe head mold.

tasks.longDescription: Go make a stone axe head in the part builder.

quests.name: Leaving the stone age
quests.description: Now that we have our iron axe head, let's take it and upgrade our mattock.  We don't need to work with stone tools anymore, and an entire combination of stats are now available to us!

tasks.longDescription: Take your iron axe head to the tool station and upgrade your mattock.

quests.name: Learning to tinker
quests.description: Let's get started on making the workstations required to make Tinkers' Tools.

tasks.longDescription: Make a blank stencil patter.  Blank patters used with regular items give you Tinkers' stations, and are used to make the patterns for tools.

quests.name: Tools of the trade 3
quests.description: Now that we have our parts, we just need to use the parts in the tool station to make our mattock.  Just pick the mattock config on the left and use your parts.

quests.name: Casting the mold
quests.description: Now we need to make aluminium brass so we can cast our molds.  Put your axe head in the casting table and pour aluminium brass over it to make an axe head cast.

tasks.longDescription: Use 1 copper chunk and 6 aluminium chunks in the smeltery to make aluminium brass, then pour it over an axe head.  Pick up the cast to verify you've made it.

quests.name: Proper work space 3
quests.description: Every Tinkerer needs a proper work space.  The third space you will be working with is your part builder.

tasks.longDescription: Use a blank pattern with a peice of wood to make a part builder.
